snippet: Individual lawmakers have been able to fund projects for their home districts in legislation that is expected to pass the House.
abstract: Federal spending bill totaling $1.1 trillion, expected to pass House, marks first time in two years that individual lawmakers have been able to put imprint on virtually every part of federal budget, in ways both subtle and direct; lawmakers are again boasting about bringing home the bacon to their state constituencies.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Individual lawmakers have been able to fund projects for their home districts in legislation that is expected to pass the House.

headline.main: $1.1 Trillion Bill to Avoid Federal Shutdown Covers Many Local Interests
headline.print_headline: $1.1 Trillion Bill to Avoid Federal Shutdown Covers Many Local Interests
